intro: [WRONG START] Artemisia ledeburiana, commonly known as silver dust sage, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and aromatic, pungent scent. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in dry, well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy plant suitable for xeriscaping. Its botanical features include fibrous roots, lance-shaped leaves, and a compact growth habit.
